root: ^Can I help you? (She peeks through the cateye on the door)
^All due respect sir, it's late night. May I ask who you're looking for?
^Doctor Elethea. We need a word with her.
^... I'll get her for you. I'll be back shortly.
^There's a few knights outside that want to speak to you.
^(It hurts... My stomach... It's so warm... I can't... move...)
^A pity, really. Bidding farewell in the position that you are. But then again, this isn’t the first and won’t be the last time I see one of these types of goodbyes.
^(Sniffs.) Who… who’s… speaking? Is this god? Am I dead?
^Don’t compare me to those imbeciles. I’m merely an observer, stumbling on your fate by chance.
^… Perhaps I was too harsh. You won’t die yet, for now.
^You feel it too don’t you, the slow fade of emotions and life away from your body. That’s soul magic. They can’t harvest it when you’re dead.
^The same that is happening to you.
^The few who can hear my voice have only one thing in common: a strong will, or a grudge to resolve.
^I will give you a choice You can either stay here and fade away, or embrace the worst of reality.
^Crawling back up, she finds a poorly bound book and takes the sword of a knight who had suddenly fell to the floor.
^Looks like I have to fight my way through.
